examples.text: our hallmark was openness to all comers
the openness of the internet makes public debate more possible

definitions: acceptance of or receptiveness to change or new ideas

examples.text: it is the openness to possibilities that creates great research
total openness to all points of view

shortDefinitions: acceptance of or receptiveness to change or new ideas

definitions: lack of secrecy or concealment; frankness

examples.text: a democratic society committed to openness and transparency

definitions: the quality of not being covered with buildings or trees

examples.text: the openness of the Western landscape

shortDefinitions: quality of land not being covered with buildings or trees

definitions: (in sports) a style of play characterized by action which is spread out over the field

examples.text: fitness levels have evolved to increase the speed and openness of the game

shortDefinitions: style of play characterized by action which is spread out over field
